column1: Sri Karanpur is a town and a municipality (Tehsil) in Ganganagar district in the Indian state of Rajasthan.
Sri Karanpur is located at 29.8414°N 73.4547°E﻿ / 29.8414; 73.4547. It has an average elevation of 185 metres (606 feet).
As of the 2001 Census of India
column2: Sri Karanpur had a population of 20
column3: 694. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Karanpur has an average literacy rate of 64%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 71%
column5: and female literacy is 56%. In Karanpur
column6: 14% of the population is under 6 years of age. Major languages spoken there are Punjabi and Bagri.

column1: Sri Karanpur once produced high quality cotton in India and attracted Birlas to set up a mill which still exists today in the town.

column2: after 1995 people shifted to other cash crops. Today
column3: the primary cash crop of the area is kinnow
column4: which is exported to West Asia.

column3: is famous for dealing  various crops such as cotton
